website_summaries.verdict: Some may find the study guide's irreverent tone challenging, but successful LSAT test takers praise its no-nonsense approach.
pros: Covers all major sections of the LSAT
Direct author contact information included with purchase
cons: More of a deconstruction of the LSAT itself, not a true study guide
Overall tone is humorous, not academic

customer_reviews.title: Helpful quick read
customer_reviews.text: I have been studying for the LSAT for a while and wanted to read something rather than practice another game or another 35-minute set for the hundredth time. This was perfect. It's a short piece; took me about 2 hours overall. Yet, I feel like I've actually learned something new to help me strategize and quit glossing over the reading comprehension passages. I'd recommend this to anyone that wants supplemental material to their practice tests. I kind of wish that it were longer just because I liked his no-bs style that much.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Confidence Builder
customer_reviews.text: As someone who did not know anything about the LSAT exam, this book has been a great help in giving me a lay of the land. I appreciate the fact that it is concise. This book takes away a lot of the fear factor of the exam, while at the same time, explaining the reality that practice is needed on my part. I believe that this book is a gem and a good place to start in preparing for the LSAT!
customer_reviews.author: joseph150

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book
customer_reviews.text: I love Nathan's sense of humor and no-nonsense approach to the LSAT. This is a bare-bones, beginner book - that is to say, it very quickly outlines the test and gives tips and tricks to get through it. It goes over each type of Analytical Reason question in depth, which I found very helpful. I would definitely purchase his other books. His point of view is so refreshing, and I loved the sometimes crass way he refers to the test - everyone is already thinking it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This book is just what I needed to dip a toe into the world of LSAT prep and create a preliminary study plan. It provides an overview of the different test sections and question types you'll encounter. It uses real LSAT questions as examples and provides straightforward but substantive explanations for each-- no tricks or gimmicks or complicated techniques. Nathan Fox swears liberally, as others have noted, so take heed if you're easily offended, but it feels to me like just an outgrowth of his no-BS approach to the test. Well worth the price, as it showed me quickly what I need to focus on so I can direct my LSAT prep resources to the areas of greatest need.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Baker

customer_reviews.title: Worth A Gander
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven’t taken the LSAT yet, Nathan does a pretty good job giving an introductory to the various aspects of entering law school/LSAT. I found the book made everything seem a bit less daunting. Content 5/5, I knocked a star off because I didn’t particularly care for the language (slightly vulgar). But overall, great book, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Me

customer_reviews.title: Quick read and gets to the point
customer_reviews.text: I think most people should start with this book when preparing for the LSAT. It presents the basics as well as strategies for approaching different types of questions. Just towards the end I learned that Nathan hosts a podcast with Ben Olson whose videos I've been listening to on YouTube. Both of them seem to know their stuff and teach in a very effective way. I got through the book quickly and got some tips that prevented me from forming bad LSAT habits (which is important, especially if you are just starting with your prep). Now I feel more ready to move on to the more comprehensive material. Thanks Nathan, this was very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Simona Stodulkova

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A good value, especially at the price of the Kindle edition. I'd recommend this as a useful prelude for those who, like me, don't intend to purchase other books or courses besides the practice tests in LSAC's PrepTest series. This book contains some useful techniques and tips. Kindle edition notes: it's not compatible with my Voyage, which caused me some head-scratching as to why my Kindle device was grayed out in the "deliver to:" drop-down menu. And there is some material for which the paper version would be more convenient in switching back and forth from the question text to discussion a few pages later, as the Kindle shows only one page at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Octalpus

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Change of pace!
customer_reviews.text: After prepping for the LSAT for a couple months and taking it, I was completely burned out. However, I decided (because I qualified for the LSAC few waiver) I would go ahead and take it again. This book was a great way to start my second prep. The style of writing may not be for everyone, but it was refreshing to read something that didn’t feel like another prep book. I highly recommend it! I’m also currently reading through his other books and listening to his podcast Thinking LSAT. All are great resources, especially if you need something different!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Step One for preparing for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: I paid for a LSAT course and walked away only ready for 50 % of the test. After reviewing this book, OMG! This should have been my first step. His language was kind of crude as other has said, but helpful. After reviewing this book, I understand a lot more than that overpriced course gave me. However, I can now go back to the literature from the overpriced course and utilize his teaching to practice on those literature. Mr. Fox asks people to give a review as it reaches the whole world. So WHOLE WORLD, buy this book! I will be purchasing more books by this author. Thank you Mr. Fox.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luke

customer_reviews.title: This author is phenomenal and made the book an easy read while also creating a pleasant environment with humor ...
customer_reviews.text: A must read for anyone considering law school! This author is phenomenal and made the book an easy read while also creating a pleasant environment with humor and relatable phrases. He even has all of his personal information included in lieu of additional questions and encourages students to contact him. He also has a podcast which I listen to every day on my way to work and I absolutely love the methods, tips, and tricks used to get a higher score. Also makes the LSAT seem like it could even go from being tortorous to being mildly fun. Get this book!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was by far the best. I haven't taken my test yet
customer_reviews.text: This was the first LSAT book I bought. It was by far the best. I haven't taken my test yet, but it introduced the test and concepts clearly and in a more engaging way than the second test book I tried at my local library ( The Princeton Review LSAT Premium). And he uses legit LSAT test questions from past tests, so you know you're getting some real practice. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mazio Pera

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and Concise
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of other study materials that I'm working with, but I think this book is invaluable to have in your arsenal because it has many of the most important concepts you'll need in a very concise volume - it's easy to review because there's no fluff. I think you get a lot of bang for your buck with this title, leaving more dough to spend on preptests. The author's podcast "Thinking LSAT" is really helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Devaney

customer_reviews.title: Great primer- but even better for reference use
customer_reviews.text: This book was my first purchase on my lsat/law school journey. It's a great breakdown of the sections. I read it once when I bought it, but then did hardly any studying for a year. Now that I'm studying all the time, I frequently pick up this book when I'm focusing on a certain question type to see Nathan's simple tips. I definitely recommend taking a free diagnostic online somewhere (untimed!), then as you begin to really study and understand the basics of the test, this book will become far easier to digest, making it ideal for rereading in lieu of other forms of studying.
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: Funny, easy to read, and very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: For someone who hates standardized testing, this book is essential. It broke down difficult concepts in order for me to be successful on the test in February 2018. My confidence is through the roof and that is half the battle! I know I will score well because I can spot my mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Asha wilson

customer_reviews.title: Legit Tips/Tricks
customer_reviews.text: I *skimmed* this book the day before taking a proctored practice LSAT and scored over 150, without any other prep being done. I’m pretty positive I could score higher if I tried, but this book touched on all of the core things to know and it legitimately helped!
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Julianne

customer_reviews.title: Great Test Prep
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea where to start in the process of studying for the LSAT. This book was amazing. So much practical, candid advice with real examples. I feel like if I went and took the exam today I would be much better prepared than going in blind and much less stressed than if I read through those huge prep books. I know I have work to do (mainly just taking tons of practice tests) but this is the best start to studying for the LSAT. I recommend that everyone start here.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hall

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing little book
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing little book! Fox gives you an honest look at all three sections with tips on maximizing your progress. Best of all, it's funny as hell. I don't know if you're like me, but I despise the LSAT. I despise the questions and their writers. I always felt antagonized and lamented my stupidity any time I got something wrong. Fox's attitude dispels the mystery and lets you in on the secret: its all BS! Now I antagonize the questions, following Fox's tips, and now I'm the one grinning at the test writers: "That the best you got?" A+ for not only helpful tips but beneficial to your psyche PS. Dolph Lundgren is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, easy to understand guide
customer_reviews.text: Great book to get ready for the LSAT. I used it at the beginning of my studying, to see what I was in for and what I would need to focus on. It worked very well for introducing the basic concepts and explaining things in a way that is easy to understand. This would also be very good at the end of studying to quickly review all the areas and question types. Games section could be expanded a little more, but I needed extra help in that department anyway. Highly recommended to anyone studying for the LSAT!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book! I had no idea where to start and was feeling very overwhelmed. This book told me the important facts about the LSAT and techniques for each type of question. He makes it easy to read and not boring, which is awesome!! I would recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Such a helpful study tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starting point in your LSAT studying. Nathan cuts through all of the intimidation and breaks down each type of question and how to think through them. This book helped me to string a lot of right questions together just by teaching me to slow down. It has helped with my untimed prep tests as I get stuck and refer back to different sections of this book. I am so excited to dig into his other books that I’ve purchased and raise my LSAT score so that I don’t have to pay for law school!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter book to understand the test as a whole
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great introduction to the LSAT- but don’t expect it to provide much help or to be the only book you need. It provides a great overview when first starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat Intro to the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Fox has a very clear and straightforward way of describing the questions on the LSAT and the approaches to tackle those questions. Personally, I don't dig some of his humor, but I like that he explains everything in a very direct way. Would recommend to anyone who is starting to study for the LSAT and wants a quick run-down of the basic approaches to its questions. Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Nathan has a sense of humor that I appreciate and makes the arduous task of preparing for the LSAT more fun and enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I've used every one of Nathan's LSAT prep books and find them to be more digestible than other companies. Nathan has a sense of humor that I appreciate and makes the arduous task of preparing for the LSAT more fun and enjoyable. I am sure with a commitment to doing the work I will achieve my intended results with the help from Nathan's expertise and experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Self-Study Component
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who is looking, and proven capable, to self-study for the LSAT should put this book in their arsenal. For me, the direct, get out of your own way, put on your big girl (or boy) pants, the test sucks because it’s supposed to tone leveled up my ability to comprehend and kept the passion for getting into law school burning. And even if you have the time and resources for guided course, it’s cheap. Buy it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get This Primer If You Have No Idea What the LSAT Has In Store!
customer_reviews.text: When I first picked this little guy up I was lost on the ground floor in the tower that some call the LSAT. After I read it from cover-to-cover I felt as though I was now on my way up with a solid map. It really goes over that much in just 100 or so pages. I am extremely happy with the time I invested in pouring over the well chosen questions and often humorous explanations. As far as the rest of my LSAT studying goes, I am definitely looking at more Fox products, just a matter of what fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence

customer_reviews.title: Down and Dirty First Step
customer_reviews.text: This is the first LSAT prep book I've read. It gave me the basics, gave me some tips, and most importantly didn't overwhelm me and fill me with hopelessness. Some other books I looked at were so daunting and this one was funny enough and clear enough that I feel like I can just maybe pass this test. I strongly recommend this book as a first step in studying for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: 24 4ever

customer_reviews.title: It's a great book for getting into the lsats
customer_reviews.text: It's a great book for getting into the lsats. Is it the most in depth book, no, but it does a great job at breaking down the LSAT. I bought powerscore and every other book out there to study and they overcomplicate it all. Not that those aren't good books to study from but if you want a simple guide as a precursor then this is your best bet. This book and a handful of old tests.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: best introduction to the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently working through Nathan's book "Exposing the LSAT" (also recommend). Before really diving into LSAT studying, it was incredibly helpful to read this short book. I honestly believe that this is the best introduction to the LSAT out there. READ IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Definitely world recommend this as the first book to read for anyone thinking about or planning on taking the LSAT in the future (near or distant). It is one of the best test-prep books I have ever read and I will definitely be looking to buy more in this series. The author is down-to earth and writes with the right amount of complexity and humor to maintain a college student's interest without feeling pandered to. My only gripe is that the book is much shorter than I was expecting but I think it is just the right length to cover what it needs to and set you in the right direction for future prep for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Informative, Concise, and Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: This book was informative and concise. It brought me a feeling of familiarity to the exam that I was previously lacking. Nathan Fox provides the reader with easy to understand, entertaining strategies. Although I have not yet taken the test, this book was a great start. I will likely update my review after taking the test in June. I recommend this book to all who are looking for a quick and helpful introduction to the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Kara B.

customer_reviews.title: Best way I could have started my law school journey!
customer_reviews.text: This book was the perfect way to start the LSAT study process. Nathan presents all information in the most real and relatable way that anyone has talked to me about law school. He doesn't deny how daunting the process is, and he is brutally honest in a way that you will really appreciate in the end. Accomplishing my LSAT and law schools goals seems much more in reach now after taking in the information provided in this short book. It's worth reading for everyone, regardless of where you are at in this process!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Excellently written
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this book. It is very personalized. The author even gives you his contact info if you want or need to reach out. It's easy to read and understand. I would definitely recommend as a first book to read!
customer_reviews.author: Becca Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical study guide - in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: Nathan Fox really breaks it down in an easy-to-understand manner. And, he wasn't lying when he said you can email him with a question and he'll answer you back. I emailed him twice and I got a response both times. I've never heard of an author actually doing something like that. I was so impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Read
customer_reviews.text: This book is so great if you're just starting out with studying for the LSAT. Not only is it witty and funny enough to keep your attention, but the author gives great tips and focuses on all the main points of the LSAT, all in under 100 pages. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Anselm

customer_reviews.title: Best Author for LSAT Learning
customer_reviews.text: N. Fox is extremely humorous in his teaching technique. You should purchase this if you are interested in understanding more of the setup of the exam. To actually do practice problems, you should purchase his larger books. Great first starter book for prospective law student.
customer_reviews.author: N D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quick introduction to the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: This book is exactly what it says it is. A quick introduction to what to expect on the LSAT. Nathan does a great job of skipping over much of the 'fluff' I have seen in other review books. He goes straight into practical examples and gives you one example of each question type you are likely to face in the test. It's a short & easy read.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great book highly recommend for future LSAT candidates!
customer_reviews.text: Great book to start with if you are even considering taking the LSAT, a no holds barred look at the LSAT. Easy to read and understand, can be read in one sitting. Really sets the stage for possible LSAT candidates. Highest recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Little Cost, High Value!
customer_reviews.text: Nathan is very generous with the information he provides in Introducing the LSAT. This book is a great introduction to the LSAT and the key things you should know. It's very little cost for a lot of information and takes very limited time to ready. I wish I'd read this first instead of floundering for a month having no idea what to do. Highly recommend to anyone taking the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Karnabi

customer_reviews.title: which is fine, but isn't where I needed help
customer_reviews.text: Mehh, it was a quick read, so I would have rather borrowed it than bought it. Focuses mostly on logical reasoning, which is fine, but isn't where I needed help.
customer_reviews.author: ohdanigirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Intro
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Awesome intro. It's definitely not the entire test to study, but if you want to whet your appetite for some serious studying, this book is definitely the easier route to start it. I really recommend it for people who want to "test the waters" before diving into a practice test or thicker books. It's short enough to finish it in couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book. Raised my confidence in my ability to ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. Raised my confidence in my ability to take the test. Gives a harsh dose of reality and if you had 72 hours to study, I'd choose this book. Remember to always be a d**k.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Informative and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is the first book I have read for LSAT prep in my free time. I find it engaging and at times humorous. I would defintely recommend it for anyone who intends to take the LSAT, or anyone who enjoys logic games. Take my review with a grain of salt, because I have yet to take the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: RuenaTG

customer_reviews.title: Greatest gift I ever gave myself
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. It is exactly what it says it is. It gets your toes wet and exposes you to everything you will absolutely NEED to know about the LSAT. Save yourself a fortune and pick this book up before you do anything else in preparation for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, awesome, awesome book
customer_reviews.text: This book is a fantastic Introdution to what is in the test. I've been afraid of even looking at a single LSAT practice test until I read this book. The test is nothing horrible as most people describe. It is an obstacle that everyone can overcome as long as it's looked from Nathan's straightforward perspective. His perspective is to call out the BS on the test and have "a chip on your shoulder" when reading through the BS to get the answers you need much like an attorney should think. I commend the author for his work and teaching style. I will now dive into Cheating the LSAT and to see where I need to improve.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Great book.
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and I just finished reading it. I am studying for the LSAT and will take the test next year. The author did a great job and I will order more books by him. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leatrice Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and to the point, yet very in-depth. Gets directly to the important information without all the fluff. I would highly recommend this to anyone preparing to sit for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: New Mommy 2015

customer_reviews.title: Quick, dirty, and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: A real clear cut book on whether or not you should be considering law school and whether or not you have an aptitude. Everyone should read this first before you buy any other books!
customer_reviews.author: GTP debunker

customer_reviews.title: Little book-big help!
customer_reviews.text: Great little book. I have never opened an LSAT book, however after reading the chapters, I was able to make sense of some LSAT practice questions--easy to read. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Geezy

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Intro Information
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to dive into your self study plan. Nathan's no nonsense approach will prove to be more worthwhile than just entertaining. I would recommend this book before beginning others.
customer_reviews.author: cami37

customer_reviews.title: Very small print. Wish it was larger and more capturing to the eye...
customer_reviews.text: Good book. If you are very traditional, the cuss words will come to a shock to you.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent insight to the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Excellent insight to the LSAT! Great tips on how to approach each section & general info on LSAT. I also love his podcast!
customer_reviews.author: Browneyedgal

customer_reviews.title: down to earth
customer_reviews.text: im getting ready to take the lsat in october and i was reading a book before buying this one and it was confusing. I like the simplicity and down to earth approach. I ordered breaking the lsat to continue my reviews
customer_reviews.author: DimiGuild

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I just got it yesterday and I've already finished it. It is an extremely helpful book to start your LSAT prep with. It works through every type of problem you can face, with examples, but it keeps it interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Brienna

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Good LSAT Overview
customer_reviews.text: Great book that quickly makes the LSAT do-able. I recommend you get this for the fun writing style and to get an overview of what the LSAT is about. It will help you get a feel for where you can stand to improve a lot. Should not be the only tool in a big prep plan, but I highly recommend starting here. The author is really helpful. Complete opposite of the stress I felt after getting the LSAC prep book.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor S.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy read!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book you can get if you want an introduction to the LSAT. It’s not overwhelming at all and isn’t confusing. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Wallace

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, I have no other words to describe these books. They are practical, down to earth, and more personal than any other formal book. I was recommended Nathan Fox by a friend and I have been hooked ever since. Nothing else compares honestly. It's nice to have the brutal truth that is interesting and thought out by another person vs boring study booklets by big companies. Highly, highly recommended! Thank you Nathan Fox!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But this book is like the no-nonsense
customer_reviews.text: If you are taking the LSAT- read this book. Yes, you still need to go through the pain of going through some of the fat prep books, and obviously taking practice tests. But this book is like the no-nonsense, cliff note version, crash course, reader's digest...etc. It puts everything into context.This is the best $8.00 I ever spent. And Nathan does answer emails and phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: PikakeFlower

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this book for those in the earliest stages of ...
customer_reviews.text: This book does exactly as it says it would, very effectively priming and introducing you to the LSAT. Having purchased the book with little knowledge of the test, the book was able to give me an organized, and well-thought out framework of the LSAT in a digestible, non-intimidating fashion, as its down-to-earth explanations are both humbling and motivating. I highly recommend this book for those in the earliest stages of LSAT preparations.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Easy Read
customer_reviews.text: I'm an engineering student taking the LSAT in February and used this book since I don't have a ton of time to commit to studying (I only signed up for the test at the beginning of January). I'm probably going to stick to what I learned in this book for my LSAT techniques, and I'll update this review once I have a real LSAT score. TL;DR: Very understandable techniques and a very easy read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Best book you’ll get
customer_reviews.text: So easy to read, so helpful. I can’t say enough good things about this book!!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Clark

customer_reviews.title: Start Here!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly helpful book. Not an end-all, be-all, but the very best place to start if you're considering the LSAT. The author actually gives out his email address and solicits questions (he was very helpful with my question!). Couldn't recommend more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this book. Full Disclosure- have not taken the LSAT yet, but this book is an easy read - filled with no nonsense advice. Thanks Nathan!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Amazing help, lots of experience
customer_reviews.text: This book was more than amazing. In 80 minutes of hard work, I learned more about the LSAT than I knew there was to know. Thanks, Nathan! Highly recommend! (Strong language present)
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Badman

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, common sense guide
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciated the quick and dirty approach to LSAT prep that Nathan takes. He gets to the point efficiently and gives some great common sense LSAT tips that other guides spend chapters elaborating. There's no extensive memorizing of question types/descriptors, you just dive into the actual work of it. I would have liked a more thorough Logic Games section, but for under 100 pages this guide introduces the exam quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great read and very helpful
customer_reviews.text: After reading this, my LSAT practice score went up 7 points from 154 to 161. Definitely worth the money and time spent.
customer_reviews.author: catmo

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the size of this book!
customer_reviews.text: This green little tome is a must buy for anyone thinking of getting into law school. Nathan Fox takes one of the world's most nerve-racking tests and turns it into a cakewalk. In approximately one hundred pages, "Introducing the LSAT" breaks down problems and explicates shortcuts that will leave your mind blown.
customer_reviews.author: LC215

customer_reviews.title: You need this before ANY other prep book!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quick read! The question types are broken down into very easy to understand language. The example questions and subsequent solutions are easy to walk through and help build upon your knowledge. This book is a must read before any other LSAT Prep book!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. I'm mean for s*** sake the guy gives ...
customer_reviews.text: I took the Kaplan prep bought all the books etc and over 2k later this guy summed it up in a 90 something page book. Not only is he realistic he s absolutely hilarious and understand the frustrations within the sections. Highly recommended. I'm mean for s*** sake the guy gives you his personal phone number just for any questions you might have. Well worth your time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Succinct and Sucessful
customer_reviews.text: I found Nathan’s book to be incredibly helpful. Before you read any other LSAT book, read this one. It cuts straight through the superfluous stuff and gets right down to the nitty gritty. His explanations are on point, his strategies are solid, and honestly, the book is really quite funny for study material. A+
customer_reviews.author: Alyse Gurak

customer_reviews.title: Great read!!! Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this book to anyone who is planning on taking the lsat. Fox lays everything out in layman's terms. Very easy read. I will definitely be ordering the other books as well. Thanks, Fox!
customer_reviews.author: Myrial Brown

customer_reviews.title: This book is a great introduction book
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my freshman year of college, and wanted to get a brief introduction on what to expect of the LSATs. This book is a great introduction book, and summarizes the concepts extremely clearly and simply for a first-timer. I would definitely recommend starting out with this book, for those who are just starting test prep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This book was a perfect way to start my LSAT prep. It had great tips and information not only about the LSAT but about law school as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marc H.

customer_reviews.title: Great explanations, test too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really like this book and having to go online to complete tests. Prefer the paper/pen method but too much to print. Great explanations.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: I no longer want to take the LAST
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that is interested in taking the LSAT or on the border should read this book. The author did an excellent job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Cus.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts right to the main point- I could not tackle ...
customer_reviews.text: Cuts right to the main point- I could not tackle logical reasoning without this guide right next to me. It makes the LSAT seem less daunting and unpredictable. Without using Nathan's advice I found myself struggling to understand how to approach each question but thankfully this book makes the LSAT totally learnable!
customer_reviews.author: Alia

customer_reviews.title: You'll laugh, you'll [maybe] cry, you'll learn
customer_reviews.text: This book really drives home the essence of the logical reasoning section. Nathan's explanations are lucid, engaging, and funny. I can't imagine another book that accomplishes the level of understanding this book does in as few pages. It's got enough content for multiple read-throughs. Look elsewhere if you're just looking for practice problems or are completely set on LR (which you aren't until you've read this book). I'd recommend the entire Fox series based on just this book.
customer_reviews.author: Haig

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't teach you how to attack LSAT problems, just how this one guy does it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro Book
customer_reviews.text: I liked this book. It's blunt and to the point, with plenty of cursing where it counts. I like the authors mentality and the quick yet thorough view of what to expect in the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Williams

customer_reviews.title: Kicks your scores and the LSAT up a notch.
customer_reviews.text: Quick, helpful, and easy to read. LSAT books foster slow learning because they are, generally, boring and thus slow to read. Fox is not - he gives the LSAT a little life and writes with pizzazz. I learned more from this quick 106 page book in one day that from pouring over other LSAT books. Plus, I now know how to make the LSAT entertaining (no one can help it in the "interesting" department) to read/take.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great first step toward the long road to the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Great book, I carry it where ever I can to study on the go. I have my heavy tomes but this is a nice light read for when I don't want to drag my book back and destroy my back.
customer_reviews.author: Nightlion

customer_reviews.title: The lsat prep book you don't want to put down
customer_reviews.text: Great book for Prepping for the LSAT. Easy to read, humorous without taking away from the information, short, and to the point. I ended up reading it multiple times, when I felt as though I needed a break from prep tests or logic game drills. What I really love about it is the way he approaches each question. Fox gives you the tools to be aggressive and attack questions, logical reasoning in particular. I only wish I would have ordered more of his products.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Study Guide
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but after going through this short primer I felt compelled. NO BULL, I have jumped up 15 points on my practice LSAT's (150-165). Believe me I am pretty slow and suffer from dyslexia and if this book can help me it can help anybody. Real LSAT coming up in about a week...I feel ready
customer_reviews.author: WellspringCole

customer_reviews.title: Introducing the LSAT - Epic
customer_reviews.text: Nathan Fox has avery down-to-earth approach in 'Introducing the LSAT.' It's a wonderful place to start and will lift your spirits before diving into full-blown study mode. I am going to pick up his other books, if not to learn from, they will certainly be entertaining at least.
customer_reviews.author: Bravo12345

customer_reviews.title: good read
customer_reviews.text: Good add on to my LSAT prep, breaks things down in a simplified way...took away some worries I had about specific things that I see now aren't that important.
customer_reviews.author: bw2014

customer_reviews.title: Best. Author. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome guide for anyone taking the LSAT. Not only does Nathan give simplified explanations to common questions, but he also responds to quenching may have by email or phone! What other author offers to do that for you?! Definitely give this a read as it is a very condensed and useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Fast as a fox to learn!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have to say this is really well written and palpable for a beginner LSAT prepper like myself!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great primer for LSAT prep
customer_reviews.text: If you are just starting to prepare for the LSAT, this book is a great introduction to the test. I am both going to take a course and study books, but this book has given me confidence ahead of the daunting prep.
customer_reviews.author: Arman Fuladvand

customer_reviews.title: Nathan Fox is a great guy and genuinely cares about you
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly helpful guide. Nathan Fox is a great guy and genuinely cares about you.
customer_reviews.author: Musicnook

customer_reviews.title: Best LSAT Prep Book!
customer_reviews.text: Along with practice test books and other materials, I ordered this book and have to say that it was extremely helpful. Nathan Fox does an excellent job in breaking down the logic and making the LSAT a little less daunting. I highly recommend this to anyone preparing to take the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book, seriously
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading online it as a helpful prep for the LSAT online. It’s a great introduction for studying for the LSAT and what makes it even better is it’s written with a bit of humor too! Must read.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Author swears but very down to earth a great read for anyone. Amazingly helpful!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for catching LSAT concept
customer_reviews.text: Quite a good book for preparing LSAT Test at the beginning. It describes the concepts of the test easily. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Seyhan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a legal background and am preparing for my LSAT. Which up until now has been a stressful endeavor. However, with Nathen's profound knowledge as well as his down & dirty just like the rest of us attitude; I am able to remember and take with me the lessons I've learned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstart to studying
customer_reviews.text: This book made the LSAT seem way less imposing. It is definitely the go-to book to start your studying with!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: This book gives clear direction and does not waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This book gives clear direction and does not waste your time. This should be your first book when beginning to study for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: JMorales

customer_reviews.title: Quick and concise!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book. It is short and Mr. Fox explains his reasoning for each question.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant. The Fox LSAT books are the only way ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. The Fox LSAT books are the only way to go. You can tell Nathan truly cares about his students and has a passion for what he does.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pulliam

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book was the best tool I found for my lsat studying!!!! God bless Nathan Fox! And don’t forget to check out the Thinking LSAT podcast!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee Lee

customer_reviews.title: A great book for getting the basics and review
customer_reviews.text: I only had hour rather than months to study for the LSAT and this book has been a big help.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: NOT a study guide
customer_reviews.text: Very very brief overview of what the LSAT consists of - this is NOT a study guide. It's a LSAT in a nutshell gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: TNN

product_meta.title: Introducing the LSAT: The Fox Test Prep Quick & Dirty LSAT Primer
